00017 struct half_edge_t{

00051   void
00052   setup_one_ring(half_edge_vci beg_in, half_edge_vci end_in)
00053   {
00054 
00055     // Get this list sorted to see if we are missing a boundary?
00056     for(half_edge_vci hedge = beg_in; hedge != end_in; ++hedge)
00057       if(this == &(*(hedge->tail))){
00058 
00059         std::list<half_edge_vci>::iterator ring_iter;
00060         for(ring_iter = A_one_ring_edges.begin(); 
00061             ring_iter != A_one_ring_edges.end(); ++ ring_iter){
00062           if(hedge->next->next->tail == (*ring_iter)->tail){
00063             break; 
00064           }
00065         }
00066         A_one_ring_edges.insert(ring_iter, hedge->next);
00067       }
00068     std::cout << "num edges in 1 ring of (" << pos[0] << " " << pos[1] << " "
00069               << pos[2] << "): " << A_one_ring_edges.size() << std::endl;
00070 
00071     std::list<half_edge_vci>::iterator ring_iter;
00072     for(ring_iter = A_one_ring_edges.begin(); 
00073         ring_iter != A_one_ring_edges.end(); ++ ring_iter){
00074       std::cout << (*ring_iter)->tail->pos[0] << " "
00075                 << (*ring_iter)->tail->pos[1] << " "
00076                 << (*ring_iter)->tail->pos[2] << "\n";
00077     }
00078   }
00079 
00080   bool
00081   inside_one_ring(const my_float_t* pt)
00082   {
00083     // intersection of line segments by closest points
00084     std::list<half_edge_vci>::const_iterator edge_list_iter;
00085     for(edge_list_iter = A_one_ring_edges.begin();
00086         edge_list_iter != A_one_ring_edges.end(); ++edge_list_iter){
00087       const half_edge_vci& edge = *edge_list_iter;
00088       geometry::line_t(edge->tail->pos, edge->next->tail->pos);
00089     }
00090     // function is not finished -- good way to test the triangle & 
00091     // one ring code -- they should produce same results (up to numerical
00092     // accuracy)
00093     return false;
00094   }
00095 
00096 private:
00097   std::list<half_edge_vci> A_one_ring_edges;
00098 };

00106 class triangle_t{
00107 public:
00108   triangle_t(vertex_vci a, vertex_vci b, vertex_vci c)
00109   {
00110     A_vertices.push_back(a);
00111     A_vertices.push_back(b);
00112     A_vertices.push_back(c);
00113     my_float_t N[3];
00114     A_area = face_normal(N);
00115 
00116     // We want the order of the vertices to be right handed with respect to the
00117     // out facing normal -- this could be troublesome if we have a messy mesh 
00118 //    std::cout << "dot product is: " << dot(a->dir, N) << std::endl;
00119     if(dot(a->dir, N) < 0.0){
00120       A_vertices[1] = c;
00121       A_vertices[2] = b;
00122     }
00123   }
00124 
00125   ~triangle_t()
00126   { ; }
00127 
00128   triangle_t(const triangle_t& src)
00129   {
00130     do_copy(src);
00131   }
00132 
00133   const triangle_t&
00134   operator=(const triangle_t& src)
00135   {
00136     if(this != &src) do_copy(src);
00137     return *this;
00138   }
00139 
00142   bool
00143   contains(const my_float_t* pt) const
00144   {
00145 #if 0
00146     std::cout << "triangle: \n";
00147     for(uint i = 0; i < 3; ++i)
00148       std::cout << A_vertices[i]->pos[0] << " " << A_vertices[i]->pos[1] << " "
00149                 << A_vertices[i]->pos[2] << "\n";
00150     std::cout << "point: " << pt[0] << " " << pt[1] << " " << pt[2] << "\n";
00151 #endif
00152 
00153     my_float_t U[3], V[3], N[3];
00154     vector(3, A_vertices[1]->pos, A_vertices[0]->pos, U);
00155     vector(3, A_vertices[2]->pos, A_vertices[0]->pos, V);
00156     cross(U, V, N);
00157 
00158     my_float_t maxval;
00159     const int drop_idx = argmaxabs<my_float_t>(N, 3, &maxval);
00160 
00161 //    std::cout << "3D normal: " << N[0] << " " << N[1] << " " << N[2] << "\n";
00162 //    U[drop_idx] = 0.0;
00163 //    V[drop_idx] = 0.0;
00164 //    cross(U, V, N);
00165 //    std::cout << "2D normal: " << N[0] << " " << N[1] << " " << N[2] << "\n";
00166 
00167     my_float_t vals[8];
00168     my_float_t* v = vals;
00169     for(int i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00170       if(drop_idx == i) continue;
00171 
00172       *v = pt[i]; 
00173       ++v;
00174       // For right handed coordinate systems we need to handle the Y direction
00175       // opposite from the others (i.e. [1,0,0] X [0,0,1] = [0, -1, 0]
00176       if((drop_idx != 1 && N[drop_idx] > 0.0) || 
00177          (drop_idx == 1 && N[drop_idx] < 0.0))
00178         for(int j = 0; j < 3; ++j, ++v) *v = A_vertices[j]->pos[i];
00179       else{
00180 //        std::cout << "swapping point order\n";
00181         *v = A_vertices[0]->pos[i];
00182         ++v;
00183         *v = A_vertices[2]->pos[i];
00184         ++v;
00185         *v = A_vertices[1]->pos[i];
00186         ++v;
00187       }
00188     }
00189     return contains(vals, vals + 4);
00190   }
00191 
00193   my_float_t
00194   face_normal(my_float_t* N)
00195   {
00196     my_float_t U[3], V[3];
00197     vector(3, A_vertices[1]->pos, A_vertices[0]->pos, U);
00198     vector(3, A_vertices[2]->pos, A_vertices[0]->pos, V);
00199     cross(U, V, N);
00200 //      std::cout << U[0] << " " << U[1] << " " << U[2] << "\n"
00201 //                << V[0] << " " << V[1] << " " << V[2] << "\n"
00202 //                << N[0] << " " << N[1] << " " << N[2] << std::endl;
00203     my_float_t rv = normalize(N);
00204 //    std::cout << "normal magnitude: " << rv << std::endl;
00205     return rv;
00206   }
00207 
00208   std::vector<vertex_vci>::const_iterator
00209   vertices_begin() const
00210   { return A_vertices.begin(); }
00211 
00212   std::vector<vertex_vci>::const_iterator
00213   vertices_end() const
00214   { return A_vertices.end(); }
00215 
00216   my_float_t
00217   area() const
00218   { return A_area; }
00219 
00220 private:
00222 
00227   bool
00228   contains(const my_float_t *x, const my_float_t *y) const
00229   {
00230     my_float_t X[3], Y[3];
00231 //    std::cout << *x << " " << *y << std::endl;
00232     for(size_t i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00233       X[i] = x[i+1] - *x;
00234       Y[i] = y[i+1] - *y;
00235 //      std::cout << x[i+1] << " " << y[i+1] << std::endl;
00236     }
00237     my_float_t b[3];
00238     cross(X, Y, b);
00239 
00240 //    std::cout << "b: " << b[0] << " " << b[1] << " " << b[2] << std::endl;
00241 
00242     // Need to determine on which side the of the triangle the point lies
00243     for(size_t i = 0; i < 3; ++i)
00244       if(b[i] < 0) return false;
00245     return true;
00246   }
00247 
00248   void
00249   do_copy(const triangle_t& src)
00250   {
00251     for(uint i = 0; i < src.A_vertices.size(); ++i)
00252       A_vertices.push_back(src.A_vertices[i]);
00253     A_area = src.A_area;
00254   }
00255 
00256   std::vector<vertex_vci> A_vertices;     
00257   my_float_t A_area;           
00258

00260   // what if the vertices move?
00261   my_float_t A_face_normal[3]; 
00262   my_float_t A_xvals[3];       
00263   my_float_t A_yvals[3];       
00264 #endif
00265 };

00376   void
00377   set_global_pos(const my_float_t* R, const my_float_t* T, 
00378                  const my_float_t* bond_dir)
00379   {
00380 //    std::cout << "Time to set the global pos of the cap" << std::endl;
00381     my_float_t local_bond_dir[3];
00382     my_gemv(3, 3, 1.0, R, 3, bond_dir, 1, 0.0, local_bond_dir, 1);
00383     my_float_t A[] = {1.0, 0.0, 0.0,
00384                       0.0, 1.0, 0.0,
00385                       0.0, 0.0, 1.0};
00386     my_float_t B[9], AB[9], ABR[9];
00387 //    std::cout << "local bond dir: " << local_bond_dir[0] << " " 
00388 //              << local_bond_dir[1] << " " << local_bond_dir[2] << std::endl;
00389 
00390     // Check if we need to rotate about Y first
00391     my_float_t tmp_dir[3];
00392     if(local_bond_dir[2] < -1E-03 || local_bond_dir[2] > 1E-03){
00393       my_float_t sin_t = local_bond_dir[2];
00394       my_float_t cos_t = std::sqrt(1.0 - sin_t*sin_t);
00395       my_float_t X_dir[] = {1.0, 0.0, 0.0};
00396 
00397       A[0] = cos_t;
00398       A[1] = 0.0;
00399       A[2] = sin_t;
00400       A[3] = 0.0;
00401       A[4] = 1.0;
00402       A[5] = 0.0;
00403       A[6] = -1.0*sin_t;
00404       A[7] = 0.0;
00405       A[8] = cos_t;
00406       my_gemm(1, 3, 3, 1.0, X_dir, 3, A, 3, tmp_dir, 3, 0.0);
00407     }else{
00408       tmp_dir[0] = 1.0;
00409       tmp_dir[1] = 0.0;
00410       tmp_dir[2] = 0.0;
00411     }
00412 
00413     // Compute the angle of the projection of both vectors in the Z=0 plane
00414 //    std::cout << "tmp_dir[X] = " << tmp_dir[0] << std::endl;
00415     my_float_t cos_t = local_bond_dir[0] / tmp_dir[0];
00416 //    std::cout << "cos(t): " << cos_t << std::endl;
00417     my_float_t sin2_t = 1.0 - cos_t*cos_t;
00418     my_float_t sin_t = 0.0;
00419     if(sin2_t > 1E-8) sin_t = std::sqrt(sin2_t);
00420     if(local_bond_dir[1] < 0.0) sin_t *= -1.0;
00421 
00422     B[0] = cos_t;
00423     B[1] = sin_t;
00424     B[2] = 0.0;
00425     B[3] = -1.0*sin_t;
00426     B[4] = cos_t;
00427     B[5] = 0.0;
00428     B[6] = 0.0;
00429     B[7] = 0.0;
00430     B[8] = 1.0;
00431     my_gemm(3, 3, 3, 1.0, A, 3, B, 3, AB, 3, 0.0);
00432 //    std::cout << "AB: " << AB[0] << " " << AB[1] << " " << AB[2] << "\n"
00433 //              << "     " << AB[3] << " " << AB[4] << " " << AB[5] << "\n"
00434 //              << "     " << AB[6] << " " << AB[7] << " " << AB[8] << "\n"
00435 //              << std::endl;
00436     my_gemm(3, 3, 3, 1.0, AB, 3, R, 3, ABR, 3, 0.0);
00437 
00438 //    std::cout << "ABR: " << ABR[0] << " " << ABR[1] << " " << ABR[2] << "\n"
00439 //              << "     " << ABR[3] << " " << ABR[4] << " " << ABR[5] << "\n"
00440 //              << "     " << ABR[6] << " " << ABR[7] << " " << ABR[8] << "\n"
00441 //              << std::endl;
00442 
00443 
00444     A_nodes.transform(ABR, T);
00445     A_nodes.set_current_positions_and_directions_as_original();
00446   }
